newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish Petkim says workers end protest.
newsitem.headline: Turkish Petkim says workers end protest.

text.p: Some 5,500 workers at two plants of Turkey's largely state-owned petrochemicals producer Petkim stopped a protest on Thursday after they were given assurances over their pay demands, its general manager Mehmet Yilmaz said.
"We have given them assurances and they stopped the protest at 3 p.m. (1300 GMT)," Yilmaz told Reuters.

About 3,300 workers at Aliaga and 2,200 others at Izmit plants of Petkim had staged a sit-in and stopped goods despatches since Monday, the second action of its kind this month over demands of higher wages.
"After I assured them, they resumed work," Yilmaz said.
He said the workers' demands would be considered at the next collective bargaining talks with the trade union.
The trade union has demanded that the workers' salaries be raised in tandem with increases in the national minimum wage, raised by 101 percent in August.
